summary: This is an FBI daily briefing from October 22, 2020, covering a wide range of national security, law enforcement, and political news. Key topics include election interference by Iran and Russia, updates on Operation LeGend, criminal investigations, the Purdue Pharma settlement, and various political developments. The document serves as a comprehensive intelligence summary for senior FBI leadership.

persons.name: John Ratcliffe
persons.context: Accused Iran of being behind threatening emails sent to Democratic voters and stated Iran and Russia obtained voter registration data.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Joined Ratcliffe in accusing Iran of election interference and stated the FBI would not tolerate foreign interference in elections.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Touted Operation LeGend in Memphis and discussed the initiative's progress in various cities.

persons.name: Hunter Biden
persons.context: Subject of reports about a laptop linked to an FBI money laundering probe and foreign business dealings.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Turned over alleged Hunter Biden laptop to Delaware authorities and was featured in a compromising scene in the 'Borat' sequel.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Denied that his son Hunter profited from the family name and criticized Giuliani's allegations.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Made comments about Facebook/Twitter bias, COVID response, court packing, and was accused of sexual misconduct by multiple women.

persons.name: Mark Meadows
persons.context: Commented on Hunter Biden laptop allegations and stimulus negotiations.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Optimistic about spending deal after election and called Trump's Chinese bank account a national security issue.

persons.name: Christopher Steele
persons.context: Commissioned the controversial dossier on Trump-Russia links, paying Igor Danchenko for 'raw intelligence.'

persons.name: Igor Danchenko
persons.context: Primary source for the Steele dossier who denied being a 'Russian agent' and described gathering 'raw intelligence.'

persons.name: James Reed
persons.context: Faced federal charges for threatening to kill Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.

persons.name: Sylvia Hofstetter
persons.context: Sentenced to 33 years for managing Tennessee's largest pill mill operation.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Trump reportedly said Fauci was seeking a job at CNN and criticized his COVID-19 advice.

persons.name: E. Jean Carroll
persons.context: Accused Trump of rape in the 1990s; her defamation case against him was discussed.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Announced designations of Chinese media companies as foreign missions and discussed unexplained illnesses among diplomats.

connections.description: Jointly announced that Iran was behind threatening emails to voters and that both Iran and Russia obtained voter data.
Father-son relationship; questions raised about whether Hunter Biden profited from or sold access to his father.
Giuliani obtained and turned over alleged Hunter Biden laptop to authorities and promoted allegations about his foreign dealings.
Steele paid Danchenko to gather 'raw intelligence' for what became the Trump-Russia dossier.
Trump reportedly frustrated that Barr and Wray haven't indicated investigations into Joe Biden or his associates.
Carroll accused Trump of rape; Trump denied it; DOJ sought to substitute U.S. as defendant in her defamation case.

events.title: Iran/Russia election interference announcement
events.description: DNI Ratcliffe and FBI Director Wray announced Iran was behind threatening emails sent to Democratic voters and that both Iran and Russia had obtained U.S. voter registration data.

events.title: Purdue Pharma $8.3B settlement
events.description: DOJ announced Purdue Pharma agreed to plead guilty to criminal charges and pay roughly $8.3 billion for its role in the opioid epidemic. The Sackler family agreed to pay $225 million in civil penalties.

events.title: Hunter Biden laptop linked to FBI probe
events.description: Fox News reported the FBI's subpoena of a laptop purportedly belonging to Hunter Biden came in connection with a money laundering investigation in late 2019.

events.title: Maryland man threatens Biden and Harris
events.description: James Reed was charged with threatening to kidnap and kill Joe Biden and Kamala Harris after leaving a threatening note at a Biden supporter's home.

events.title: DOJ designates Chinese media as foreign missions
events.description: Secretary of State Pompeo announced the State Department is designating the U.S. operations of six more China-based media companies as foreign missions.

events.title: Senate Judiciary Committee vote on Barrett
events.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee was scheduled to vote on Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett, with Democrats planning to boycott the vote.

keyFacts: U.S. intelligence officials accused Iran of being behind threatening emails sent to Democratic voters and said both Iran and Russia had obtained U.S. voter registration data.
Purdue Pharma agreed to plead guilty to criminal charges and pay roughly $8.3 billion for its role in the opioid epidemic, with the Sackler family paying $225 million in civil penalties.
A laptop allegedly belonging to Hunter Biden was subpoenaed by the FBI in late 2019 as part of a money laundering investigation, according to documents obtained by Fox News.
Attorney General William Barr touted Operation LeGend in Memphis, announcing 5,500 arrests nationwide under the initiative designed to curb violent crime.

The parents of 545 migrant children separated at the border by the Trump administration could not be found, according to court filings, though the administration blamed parents for declining reunification.
